net.joala.condition.timing

Interface WaitFailStrategy

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractWaitFailStrategy, WaitAssertionFailStrategy, WaitAssumptionFailStrategy, WaitTimeoutFailStrategy

    public interface WaitFailStrategy

    Strategy what to do if a condition does not get fulfilled within time. Possible options are to signal just the timeout or that an assertion/assumption failed.

    Since:
    8/23/12

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void fail(String reason, Object function, Object input, Throwable throwable, long consumedMillis)
      Makes a condition fail because the expected value could not be retrieved because of repeating evaluation exceptions.
      <T> void fail(String reason, Object function, Object input, T lastValue, org.hamcrest.Matcher<? super T> matcher, long consumedMillis)
      Makes a condition fail because the expected value did not get returned in time.

    • Method Detail

      • fail

        <T> void fail(@Nullable
            String reason,
            @Nonnull
            Object function,
            @Nonnull
            Object input,
            @Nullable
            T lastValue,
            @Nonnull
            org.hamcrest.Matcher<? super T> matcher,
            @Nonnegative
            long consumedMillis)
        Makes a condition fail because the expected value did not get returned in time.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the value type returned by the function
        Parameters:
        reason - reason of the failure
        function - function evaluated
        input - original input to the function
        lastValue - the last value retrieved via function
        matcher - the matcher which did not match
        consumedMillis - consumed milliseconds

        function - function evaluated
        input - original input to the function
        throwable - last exception which got caught
        consumedMillis - consumed milliseconds
